results.title: Five easy pizzas
results.creator_credit: Australian Film Commission, Jo Bell, Mark Hanlin, Garry Richards, Clayton Jacobson and Ray Boseley
results.brief_description: A collection of five Australian short comedy films, linked by a pizza delivery man having one of those days when nothing seems to go right. “Bernie’s Magic Moment”: a fanatical Collingwood football club supporter (Chris Haywood) is doing the ironing and gets carried away watching a football match; “Gran’s Big Adventure”: Bunney Brooke plays an old lady who becomes locked in a sofa and ends up having a ball of a time; “Midday Crisis”: a man training to be a private investigator discovers the wisdom in not interfering in a neighbour’s business; “Environmental”: a nerdy guy (Kym Gyngell) is terrorised by a radical greenie; “Prickly Heat”: the pizza delivery man finally loses his cool completely. A very funny and stylish collection of films.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Film Commission, Jo Bell, Mark Hanlin, Garry Richards, Clayton Jacobson and Ray Boseley

results.title: Five children and It
results.brief_description: When Cyril, Anthea, Bob and Jane visit the seaside for a holiday, they discover the sandpit home of a Psammead, a strange looking sand fairy with the marvellous ability to make wishes come true. The children begin wishing - to be rich, to be beautiful - all with disastrous results. But then, they go even further and wish their baby brother Lamb away … Based on the classic children’s novel by E. Nesbit, author of “The Railway children”

results.title: Five billion years
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, David Verrall, Derek Lamb and Joyce Borenstein
results.brief_description: This superbly animated science film traces the evolution of North America from the Earth’s geophysical beginnings, through the genesis of the first living organisms, right up to the arrival of humans. Radiant colors and smooth-flowing animation evoke sizzling lava rivers, oceans bursting with life, and freezing ice ages. The film provides an excellent view of the time frame within which these remarkable events took place and highlights the fact that, relatively speaking, we are newcomers to Planet Earth. (Awards: Houston)

results.title: Five bells: sights and sounds of Sydney Harbour
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Suzanne Baker and Dean Semler
results.brief_description: Sydney Harbour, the most beautiful in the world, is celebrated in this lyrical documentary. Pre-dawn a memory of the Harbour’s convict past appears like a dream, but as the sun rises and the trawlers trek back with their cargo of prawns the Harbour comes to life in 1978. Australia’s multi-cultural society is epitomised in this film.

results.title: Five Aboriginal dances from Cape York
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, John Martin-Jones and Ian Dunlop
results.brief_description: The legends and stories of the aborigines have been kept alive in song and dance. This film shows dancing at the Aurunum Mission Station in the north of Queensland. The dances are: “ATHA AND PANTJ” - three men die and change into the crow, dove and gecko lizard; “MUIPAKA” - the penalty for adultery is death; “NINGKUSHUN AND ORPUL” - Orpul the fairy girl created the freshwater shark; “PIKUWA AND KENA” - the freshwater and saltwater crocodile fight; “PIPAPEPE” - the courting and mating of the curlews.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, John Martin-Jones and Ian Dunlop

results.title: Fitzroy: coming up for air
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Peter Dodds
results.brief_description: An overview of aspects of life in Fitzroy, an inner-city suburb of Melbourne, where there are a large number of Housing Commission high-rise blocks of flats. Residents and people working in the community discuss the quality of life in Fitzroy.

results.title: Fitzroy
results.brief_description: Shows the great difficulties and final success of climbing the South East buttress of Mount Fitzroy in South America in 1968. The early part of the film discusses Captain Robert Fitzroy, who explored the coast of Argentina, and his naturalist Charles Darwin who did extensive work in Patagonia.

results.title: Fitting the job to the worker: an introduction to ergonomics
results.creator_credit: British Productivity Council, Merton Park, Frank A. Hoare and David Cons
results.brief_description: An introduction to industrial ergonomics, a subject covering the study of all factors affecting the physical and psychological relationship between man and his artificial environment, including such factors as lighting, display, heat and sound, and age.
